meanings.definition: A type of hat with earflaps, typically made of fur or wool.
meanings.sent1: I wore my chapka to keep my ears warm in the snow.
meanings.sent2: The chapka was cozy and protected my head from the cold wind.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy chapka made me look like a cute bear in the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her chapka was a furry shield against the icy chill of the blizzard.
meanings.sent5: The chapka's earflaps hugged my cheeks like a warm embrace.

meanings.definition: To wear a chapka for warmth in cold weather.
meanings.sent1: I chapkaed up before going out into the freezing snowstorm.
meanings.sent2: She always chapkas when the temperature drops below zero.
meanings.sent3: He chapkaed so much that he looked like a walking furball.
meanings.sent4: Chapkaing up, she braved the winter cold with a smile.
meanings.sent5: Remember to chapka before stepping out into the icy winter air.

meanings.definition: The chapka was popularized in Russia and other cold climates.
meanings.sent1: In Russia, the chapka is a symbol of warmth and tradition.
meanings.sent2: The chapka's popularity spread to many snowy regions around the world.
meanings.sent3: The chapka became the go-to headgear for chilly weather enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The chapka's rise to fame in cold climates was swift and enduring.
meanings.sent5: The chapka's roots in Russia have branched out to global admiration.
